title: JSON Schema accessElineOperatorUni - Quote, updated: 2020730 ( #2 )
description: MEF Forum LSO Sonata Product Schema for Access E-Line OperatorUni - Function: Quote

connectorType.description: Operator UNI Connector Type - No reference. Should be in a future rev of MEF 26.x

numberOfLinks.description: Operator UNI Number of Links - MEF 26.2 §14.4

portConversation.description: Operator UNI Port Conversation ID to Aggregation Link Map - MEF 26.2 §14.6 and 802.1AX-2014 § 6.6.2.1

maximumServiceFrameSize.description: Operator UNI Maximum Service Frame Size - MEF 26.2 §14.8

defaultCeVlanId.description: Operator UNI Default CE-VLAN ID - MEF 26.2 §14.9

maximumNumberOfOvcEndPoints.description: Operator UNI Maximum Number of OVC End Points - MEF 26.2 §14.10

maximumNumberOfCeVlanIdsPerOvcEndPoint.description: Operator UNI Maximum Number of CE-VLAN IDs per OVC End Point - MEF 26.2 §14.11

ingressBandwidthProfile.description: Operator UNI Ingress Bandwidth Profile per UNI - MEF 26.2 §14.12

egressBandwidthProfile.description: Operator UNI Egress Bandwidth Profile per UNI - MEF 26.2 §14.13

lagLinkMeg.description: Operator UNI LAG Link MEG - MEF 26.2 §14.16

l2cpAddressSet.description: Operator UNI L2CP Address Set - MEF 26.2 §14.20

objBWP.description: The MEF Bandwidth Profile 11-tuple as described in MEF 10.4 section 12.1.2. (MEF 10.4 actually defines a 10-tuple where Envelope Name and Rank are a single attribute).

cir.description: The Committed Information Rate for the BWP

cirmax.description: The Maximum Committed Information Rate for the BWP

cbs.description: The depth in bytes of the Committed Token Bucket

eir.description: The Excess Information Rate for the Bandwidth Profile

eirmax.description: The Maximum Excess Information Rate for the Bandwidth Profile

ebs.description: The depth in bytes of the Excess Token Bucket

cf.description: Do overflow tokens at this level flow down to the next committed bucket or to the corresponding excess bucket?

cm.description: Does the policer consider the color marking in the incoming frame?

envelopeName.description: The name of the envelope that this Bandwidth Profile resides in.

envelopeRank.description: The rank in the envelope of this BWP

offset.description: A number of bytes (positive or negative) to include in the Bandwidth Profile calculation to account for headers.

objEnvelope.description: Bandwidth Profiles are organized into Envelopes. Multiple Bandwidth Profiles in an envelope can share bandwidth resources. Each Envelope has a name and a flag (CF0) that indicates whether unused green tokens are discarded or converted to yellow tokens.

cf0.description: Envelope Coupling Flag indicates how unused tokens at the lowest level are handled.

objConvToAggLink.description: 2-tuple {x,y} where x is a VLAN or range of VLANs and y is a list of Link Aggregation Links. This is used in the Port Conversation to Aggregation Link Map for the Operator UNI and ENNI.

objVlanRange.description: A range of VLANs allowing three forms: x, x → x, and x → y

start.description: The starting VLAN of the range or the only VLAN

end.description: The final VLAN in the range

objL2cpIdentifer.description: This describes an L2CP as a MAC Address and Protocol Identifier as described in MEF 45.1 section 8.2.

macAddr.description: The MAC Address of the L2CP to be peered.

protocolIdentifier.description: The protocol identifier field for identifying L2CP Protocols to Peer.

objL2cpProtocolIdentifier.description: This is one of:  EtherType (four hex digits), (2) LLC (2 hex digits), or (3) EtherType/Subtype (4 hex digits and 2 hex digits)

protoID.description: The EtherType or LLC Address or EtherType/SubType

objEtherTypeSubType.description: This is a two-tuple consisting of an Ethernet Type 0xDDDD and a SubType 0xDD

objDisabled.description: An object that includes a single property, the constant DISABLED
